title: IMCG F-7/4 holds parent-teacher meeting to strengthen school-home partnership
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 7 (APP):Islamabad Model College for Girls (PG-Margalla) F-7/4, on Tuesday held a parent-teacher meeting aiming to promote communication between parents and teachers for students’ academic progress.
The meeting was organized by the Students Council under the supervision of the In-charge College Students Council, following the directions of Principal Professor Ayesha Kayani.
The event began with the recitation from the Holy Quran, followed by a Naat. It concluded with the national anthem. A large number of parents attended the session, showing their interest in their daughters’ education. Principal Ayesha Kayani welcomed the parents and appreciated their participation.
The guest speakers, Dr Aisha Zubair, Professor of Psychology and Haifa Nasir, Clinical Psychologist, from Quaid-i-Azam University, spoke about ways to support students through better parental guidance.
The meeting provided an opportunity for parents and teachers to discuss students’ academic and personal development.  Both sides agreed on the need for continued cooperation to help students perform better.
